modl.Type.name: modl.Type
modl.Type.description:
The pseudo Type class for the modl type system. This class is
used to describe the available methods within the type system itself.

Actually there is no Type class, just the added functionality for the
classes created with this type system.

The type constructor should be called without the new keyword itself,
it will receive the constructor function, add some features to it and
the return the same reference.

The constant method is also assigned to the constructor's prototype.
This way it's instances also benefits from the constant method.

If the constructor is ommited, an empty constructor is created.

modl.Promise.name: modl.Promise
modl.Promise.description: The Promise class implements a simple promise mechanism.

params.name: synchronous
params.description: Indicates if the promise can be synchronous

modl.Ready.name: modl.Ready
modl.Ready.description:
The Ready class provides the functionality of scheduling callbacks
for when a given Ready instance is marked as ready

modl.Asset.name: modl.Asset
modl.Asset.description:
The Asset class represents an script file being loaded within a
module.

modl.Module.name: modl.Module
modl.Module.description: The Module class represents a module within the module tree. It can load other modules(dependencies contained within node_modules directory) and assets (files referenced within a module).

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent module for this one

params.name: hydrating
params.description: Indicates that this module is being hydrated and should not be initialized automatically

modl.Loader.name: modl.Loader
modl.Loader.description: The loader class responsible for loading the various dependencies between modules and assets

modl.Bilbo.MockingBag.name: modl.Bilbo.MockingBag
modl.Bilbo.MockingBag.description: The MockingBag is a bag creates and stores empty objects when things are not found within. It's intended for testing usage. When the bag creates objects it will store them with the "stuff" storage method. Like so, modifying objects will modify created references within.

modl.Util.name: modl.Util
modl.Util.description: Exported utilities class from modl module system

Passes created tokens to a given function. The number of created

Returns the returned value from the given function.

classitems.description:
Resolves a constant value within the constructor itself.
If it doens't have the constant directly, it walks up the
inheritance tree looking for it.

classitems.description:
Defines a set of constant within the constructor
itself. Uses the values object as key/value pairs to
define the constants.

params.name: values

classitems.description: Defines a single constant within the constructor.

classitems.description:
Stores the shared tokens within the constructor's
closure, so whenever a descendant asks for the ancestors

classitems.description:
Creates a new type descendant from this one. It applies
the same syntatic suggar as it's parent and does the

If ommited, a constructor that calls the superclass is
created and returned.
classitems.name: descend

The module instance to be passed along to the exports

The callback function to be executed when all the
requires are ready

classitems.description:
Attach a given asset to this Loader. When the loader is
ready, the asset will also be market as ready
classitems.name: attachAsset

Dispatches the loader processing. It will start loading all
its requires and finally will run the payload function.

classitems.name: loadUses

return.description: A promise for when all the requires are ready.

classitems.name: loadUse

return.description: The promise for when the use is done

classitems.description: Requires an asset from it. The resource string may have the following formats: - "/path/to/asset: in this case the asset within the current module will be loaded - "module": in this case the "module" within node_modules folder will be required, and afterwards the /module asset within the module will be loaded. Optionally an alias property may be passed to name the required asset within the imports object. If ommited, the alias will be automatically generated based the resource value.
classitems.name: uses

params.name: resource
params.description: A given resource to be required

params.name: alias
params.description: An optional alias which to be named within the imports object.

classitems.description: Schedules a given payload function export the asset. The payload will only run when all the requires are loaded and ready for prime time. When called, the payload function will receive the module struct as its first argument. The imports will be passed as subsequent arguments in order. The module object will have an exports property which will be published for this asset. This property can be overwritten with any value this asset may want to publish (a la nodejs module system). The module object will also have an imports object containing all required resources. Every imports will be passed along as parameters to the payload function
classitems.name: unit

classitems.description: Return the bag's name
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
Empties the bag, and vanishes it removing it from bilbo
altogether.
classitems.name: vanish

classitems.description: Empties the bag, removing all stored stuff from within
classitems.name: empty

classitems.description:
Tries to grab a stored stuff. If a given thing can't be found
within the bag, it throws an error.

It may also receive aditional arguments if the storage method
supports varargs.
classitems.name: grab

params.name: args*
params.description: Optional arguments passed to stored thing if supported

classitems.description: Stores an object within this bag under a given name. When grab is called, it will give a new object having the previous object as prototype.
classitems.name: prototype

params.name: proto
params.description: The object to be used as prototype

classitems.description: Stores something within the bag itself. When grab is called, it will give it back as is.
classitems.name: stuff

classitems.description: Stores a lazy initializer. When grab is called, it will call the lazy function and return it's value. Subsequent calls will always receive the same value. The lazy function may receive aditional arguments upon calling grab as varargs
classitems.name: lazy

classitems.description: Stores a factory function. When grab is called, it will call the factory function and return it's value. The factory function may receive aditional arguments upon calling grab as varargs
classitems.name: factory

classitems.description: Stores a constructor to be used as a singleton. When grab is called, it will instantiate the object using the type as a constructor for it. Subsequent calls will always receive the same instance. The constructor may receive aditional arguments upon calling grab as varargs
classitems.name: singleton

classitems.description: Stores a constructor to be used as a type constructor. When grab is called, it will instantiate the object using the type as a constructor for it. The constructor may receive aditional arguments upon calling grab as varargs
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: Registers a thing within the bag itself with a specific storage method. The bag looks for a property named "precious" or "ã€‡" (Unicode Character 'IDEOGRAPHIC NUMBER ZERO' (U+3007)) within the thing. The property may have the following values as hints: "prototype", "lazy", "singleton", "factory", "type", and "stuff". The default storage method is "singleton" for functions or "stuff" for objects.
classitems.name: register

classitems.description:
Just like {{#crossLink "modl.Bilbo.Bag"}}{{/crossLink}}'s
grab method but when it cannot find stuff within, it creates a
new object and stores within itself.
classitems.name: grab

classitems.description: Retrieves or creates a new bag
classitems.name: bag

classitems.description: Creates and returns a bilbo.MockingBag
classitems.name: mockingBag

classitems.description: Gives a bag for bilbo to keep

Vanishes all bags reseting bilbo to it's initial state. All bags
will be emptied, existing references will still be valid, but all
bags will have nothing inside.
classitems.name: vanish

classitems.description: Simply creates Loader and returns it. Good for instrumenting purposes, in case you need a reference without calling {{#crossLink "modl/uses:method"}}{{/crossLink}} or {{#crossLink "modl/unit:method"}}{{/crossLink}} methods
classitems.name: loader

classitems.description: Creates a Loader and requires an asset from it. The resource string may have the following formats: - "/path/to/asset: in this case the asset within the current module will be loaded - "module": in this case the "module" within node_modules folder will be required, and afterwards the /module asset within the module will be loaded. Optionally an alias property may be passed to name the required asset within the imports object. If ommited, the alias will be automatically generated based the resource value.
classitems.name: uses

params.name: resource
params.description: A given resource to be required

params.name: alias
params.description: An optional alias which to be named within the imports object.

classitems.description: Creates a Loader and schedules a given payload function export the asset. The payload will only run when all the requires are loaded and ready for prime time. When called, the payload function will receive the module struct as its first argument. The imports will be passed as subsequent arguments in order. The module object will have an exports property which will be published for this asset. This property can be overwritten with any value this asset may want to publish (a la nodejs module system). The module object will also have an imports object containing all required resources. Every imports will be passed along as parameters to the payload function
classitems.name: unit

classitems.description: Sets up the modl module environment. It will reset all loaded modules and will set up the settings object along with the values passed along with the options parameter. This function MUST be called before any require/exports can be actually made.
classitems.name: setup

props.name: root
props.description:
The root directory form which to
           load all assets and modules

classitems.description:
Dispatches the loading of a concatenated module. This method
should be called only by machine generated code.
classitems.name: $module

classitems.description: Returns a function that when called returns always the same starting value
classitems.name: constant

classitems.description: A function that does nothing and returns undefined. Useful when you need a noop function
classitems.name: k

classitems.description:
Returns a function that whe called, passes the arguments
collection as an array to the passed function as its first
parameter.
classitems.name: args

classitems.description: Processes the function on the next tick
classitems.name: work

classitems.description: Short for object.hasOwnProperty(property)
classitems.name: hop

classitems.description:
Copy the properties from the "source" object onto the
"target" object. Optionally it can be passed an array
containing the property-list to be copied, if ommited, all
own properties should be copied.
classitems.name: merge

classitems.description:
Looks for the first ocurrence that satisfies the conditional
function of a given value within an array or an object,
returning its index or property.

The conditional function will be called for each item within
the collection, it will receive the item as first parameter
and its index as the second. The function must return a
boolean indicating whether the condition has been met.
classitems.name: indexOf

classitems.description:
Returns the first ocurrence that satisfies the conditional
function of a given value within an array or an object.

The conditional function will be called for each item within
the collection, it will receive the item as first parameter
and its index as the second. The function must return a
boolean indicating whether the condition has been met.

If the function is ommited, it will return the first item
within the collection.
classitems.name: first

classitems.description:
Executes a function for each item within the collection
(array or object), passing the item itself as the first
parameter and it's index as the second parameter.
classitems.name: forEach

classitems.description:
Iterates through the items of a collection, calling the map
function for each of those items, passing the item itself as
first parameter and it's index as the second parameter. The
function's return will be pushed to a new array that will be
returned in the end.
classitems.name: map
slice

classitems.description:
Kind of a method overloading. It should be called passing
various functions, each with a different number of declared
parameters.

It will return a function that depending of the number of
arguments passed, will call the respective function. If there
is no respective function for a given number of arguments,
the latter function will be used as default.
classitems.name: overload

classitems.description:
Returns a function that when called, it will pass the _this_
object as first parameter, along with the remaining
parameters if any.
classitems.name: that

classitems.description:
Method used to create a new class using the functionality
described in the pseudo {{#crossLink "modl.Type"}}{{/crossLink}} class
classitems.name: type

classitems.description:
Inherit the prototype methods from one constructor into
another. The prototype of constructor will be set to a new
object created from superConstructor.

As an additional convenience, superConstructor.prototype will
be accessible through the constructor.ancestor property,
along with other facilities within the modl's type
suggar.

The method returns the constructor reference.
classitems.name: inherits

classitems.description:
Creates tMODULE_REFERENCEhe prototype bond between a constructor and its
superConstructor, nothing more.
classitems.name: bond

classitems.description: A reference to the undefined value
classitems.name: undef

classitems.description: Shortcut for {{#crossLink "modl.Token/tokens:method"}}{{/crossLink}}'s method
classitems.name: tokens
